pros: The pay was more then my previous employer
cons: Management is terrible, favortism and conflicts of interest are rampid,  mistreatment of new employees, unprofessional way of addressing matters. They will try and find a way to get rid of you if they decide they do not like you.  Supervisors will make decisions out of self interest instead of the well being of the company or its associates.

pros: Great benefits package from day one of employment. You get vacation right away. Medical/Dental/Vision all available.
cons: Micromanagment from regional level all the way down to each branch. There seem to be a lot of pointless conference calls.

review_title: If you're looking for growth, look elsewhere...
pros: Insurance and 401k benefits are great.
cons: No one on one coaching, reviews not received timely.  Growth opportunity is stunted and based on current pay.  Regardless if you further your education, growth will not happen unless you change companies.  Job duties do not translate to usable career skills.

review_title: High pressure and never satisfied with your efforts!
pros: Give you leads thru relationship bankers, sometimes.
cons: Manager says I am here to help you but was really there presure you if you did not make monthly quota. The atmosphere of "What have you done for me lately" ! Manager  presure you to sell whatever to clients to make quota and doesn't care if it's good or not for client.

review_title: New to the company and loving it
pros:
Better than average bank environment. 
Pension, 401k and wellness programs set it far above other employers
If you take care of yourself, the company pays you to have health insurance.
cons: Branches outside of the core market are expected to work without much name recognition. Word of mouth is key.

review_title: If you're under the right management, its a great place to work with great opportunities.
pros: BB&T is a solid company/bank that isnt going anywhere anytime soon. The benefits are GREAT! Salary is okay. Higher then most banks.
cons: Depending on what branch you are in, dont think about having a life of the weekends. They will make you work every Saturday even when it is suppose to be 'rotated'.

review_title: Not a good place to work.
pros: Winston Salem is a small town, so everything is close to headquarters.
cons: Management is spending money like its water.  There is a definite problem to be promoted past a mid manager level if you don't originate in the LDP.  Culture presentations via postings and quarterly video's was nice to hear, but I didn't see it lived up to.

review_title: Great if you have no other opportunities.
pros: Decent wages with competitive benefits. Attempts made to have an ethical culture through pseudo-philosophical training. Training given on a semi-regular basis.
cons: CEO down through management have no issues lying to employees. Employees routinely work without meal breaks or sufficient staff to perform assigned tasks. Sterling Award system is popularity over merit of  employees. Opportunities not given for internal advancement, but instead outside hires are often brought into the company for lower benefit expense.

pros: The pay is nice. Most of the people seem to be very friendly.
cons:
Training is very questionable. I went through a temp agency & was excited to get such a "great opportunity". I was put with a team leader who was, for the most part unhappy to have the responsibility of training me. That was nerve-wrecking for me! She would stop mid-training to go do other things. I spent about 6 days learning to navigate the system that took 4 days for me to gain complete individual access. Then, I spent half the day on the phone for the first time with my trainer on a splitter. By lunch 12pm, someone called her into a meeting. When I came back from lunch she came & sat with me again for less than than an hour & disappeared again. At this point I'm more nervous than when I began because my training wasn't at all consistent. Later she dumped me on someone else. The following day, this trainer gave me 5 worksheets to work on while she did work on her own system. By lunch, I got a call from the temp agency telling me they feel I'm "not comfortable'! I've NEVER been in any company that decides to end a contract after 1 attempt at training with trainee taking calls. Then nobody Sheffield to inform why I was being sent home. 
Nobody actually even spoke to me to inform me what needed to be done to get better with my calls since I'm new. Lastly, as I'm getting my things together & saying bye to my cube neighbor who was very nice to me, a really mean lady comes up to me & says "you have to leave!" & even rode me down in the elevator to make sure. This lady is the work buddy of my trainer, they go on all they're breaks together & both seem like the meanest people in the building. This was a HORRIBLE experience! No money is worth being treated like this! I felt they just needed some ridiculous reason to get my trainer out of doing her job. Then I felt ganged up on & bullied!

pros: I really enjoyed working for this company. They care about their employees. Kind of sad I left. Great Company all around.
cons: Not much to say here. They were a great company. I just wanted to do something different but realized I left something good...

pros: Well established institution w/ over 140 years of banking experience. Survived several recessions and is still growing. Making moves to be more tech savvy.
cons: Too much red tape to make changes to stay in the forefront of the industry from personal banking, to payments.

pros: Their are great people you get to work with at BB&T - you will have the chance to build great relationships with colleagues!
cons: The @Work management is absolutely horrendous! The @Work leader hires managers who have little experience, no idea how to manage a team, and are overall pretty incompetent. It was a shame when I consistently asked my manager for feedback so I could become better and was only told "you're doing great" with no constructive criticism. My manager was an embarrassment to the region and I continually had to field calls from other internal partners complaining about their "leadership". When I was faced with obstacles or challenges, my manager kept telling me he'd get it figured out but would do absolutely nothing. I realized after a while, my manager was pushing his own agenda - and it wasn't in the best interest of the company. After just two years in the role, I began to hate it but stuck it out in hopes of things getting better. The program is a joke and the company preaches work life balance but then wants you to do 5am presentations, networking events at night, and work on the weekends. Take my advice - run and don't ever look back! I regret having wasted so many years in a dead end job. BB&T pays much less than other banks and after leaving, I was able to get a six figure job where I'm actually challenged and appreciated.

pros: It's a job and the pay was decent.
cons:
Unfortunately, although pay was decent, I was only PT, so I didn't earn enough to support myself.
Training for this job where you handled accounts and money only lasted 2 days.
Coworkers who were supposed to be supportive were rude and curt time (although they had plenty of time to chit chat with customers about their personal business).
I was hired right before the manager went on a 2 week leave, so I couldn't go to her for help
I was required to answer the phone while assisting customers standing right in front of me.
Customers were charged so many fees that they often asked me to do tasks that they'd normally have to pay BB&T for (such as rolling coins, printing account transactions & balances, etc.) I didn't mind helping the customers, but this made for long lines in the lobby.
Rules were applied inconsistently, which made it particularly hard for me as a new employee. One time a customer yelled at me, then filed a complaint because I would not allow her to withdraw $1300 from her account WITH NO ID WHATSOEVER. Instead of thanking me for helping to protect her account, I was punished for it. She said that the other tellers let her do it, so I should also. I had no idea if this woman was the actual account holder. (Who leaves the house w/o any form of ID?? Especially if you're visiting the bank!)
When I couldn't get anyone to help me if I had a transaction I couldn't figure out, I was reprimanded for attempting to resolve it myself.

pros:
Company puts a lot of resources into training and improving employee knowledge and skills.
Good Benefits.
Secure.
cons: Poor time-off benefits.  Hard to Move up to a new position.

review_title: Conservative company in a changing world
pros:
Decent pay, decent benefits. Occasionally work from home at individual manage's discretion. Professional membership 
dues paid. Did not need TARP money.
cons:
Very siloed company. Little cooperation or compromise across departments. 
Many promotions are completely mystifying (who you know). Upper 
management very plugged in to good ol' boy network (it's a southern
company).

review_title: BB&T is a strong company, but a bit behind the times.
job_title: Business Loan Administration Credit Analyst I
pros: It is a strong and stable company which takes care of the health of its employees.
cons:
BB&T believes in "total compensation" meaning your salary will not be as great as rival companies but your health and life benefits are stronger than many others.

Technology lags behind some competitors, many of our systems are unable to communicate effectively.

pros: The Cons really outweigh the Pros but the company does have good people. Working here helped develop my skills as a professional but that is everywhere.
cons: Not really a company for millennials. Does not offer much flexibility. The company does not allow you to work from home when it makes sense much and there is not much opportunity for growth. BB&T is so far behind other banks on its systems also. It is 2014 and the bank's system are very outdated.

pros: Great company with solid management and good company culture.  The bank is ethical and is very risk averse.  Strong training organization.
cons: While the benefit package is outstanding, base pay tends to be on the lower side of industry.  Very conservative work environment.

pros: Make you a better and more balanced banker, with opportunities to truly lean the art of being a banker.
cons: Playing catch-up to the rest of the industry (for larger banks) in regards to sales, which makes there some growing pains to catch-up. Ask a lot of bankers, as opposed to other larger banks, which require you to focus solely on lending and banking, nothing else.

pros: Great place to work for the most part.  Wonderful benefits.
cons:
Sales and referrals are a huge part of everything now. 
Less for more.  One person doing the job of 2 or more.

review_title: They use you then toss you
pros: The pay is good. It's smaller than other banks so you get a homely feel.
cons: They will use you to do excessive work and then just toss you at the drop of a dime. Because they pay a little more than other banks, it's easy for them to replace you.

job_title: Certified Senior Teller in West Raleigh, NC
pros: Good working relationships with direct managers and area ops personnel
cons: Regional staff conduct layoffs of seasoned employees 15 - 20 years + in exchange for unexperienced employees right out of college to save a couple of dollars per hour in wages.  No security anymore with your job

pros: They pay more than most banks starting...training was great to perform job
cons: Was made to do more commuting to relieve other branches more than what I was contracted to do...at times given no lunch break but made to relieve others for theirs

pros: Most are great people to work with. Some really smart people working there, and some good benefits. Good flex time
cons: Overworked engineers, lousy raises, do more with less, cube sharing, micro-managing managers. High medical deductible, slow to get anything decided, then hurry up and get done no matter the cost to employees time or health.

review_title: Excellent early career track, but stagnant once in middle management.
job_title: Senior Vice President in Nashville, TN
pros: BB&T provides great benefits, high-quality people, exposure to many aspects of financial services industry. Ability to advance early in one's career.
cons: Too much micro-management, not very entrepreneurial or tech savvy, not very intellectually challenging, little decision-making authority outside executive management team.

pros: Bankcard is a great environment to work in
cons: All the overall company cares about is profits and not always about what's best for the client/customer.

pros: The only pro is that you receive a paycheck and that’s not even saying much because they aren’t even paying much.
cons: Your typical good ol boy down south conservative company, no diversity in management!  Anytime a company says they have a CONSERVATIVE way of doing business, RUN! The department is ran by a bunch of incompetent child like individuals. You’re forced to participate in their kiddy activities. The turnover rate is extremely high and it’s not because people are being promoted so don’t believe that lie they feed to you in the interview. It’s because people are running out of the door and they don’t even respect this department enough to give them a notice. Every couple of weeks you have the pleasure of knowing someone is getting out of the sunken place! They all just up and quit and it’s very much deserving. The nepotism and favortism is ridiculous. There was a new employee who was on Quality Control for an unacceptable extended amount of time  which isn’t normal protocol.  Had it been anyone else, they would’ve been terminated. The employee wasn’t even qualified for the job but got it because of someone he knew who worked for the bank.  He even told the person that he wasn’t qualified for the job and he still received an offer.  I heard through the grapevine that said employee is no longer there which makes sense because his qualifications weren’t up to par to begin with.

pros: No Micro Manage, Good Benefits, Good Resources, Good Bonus, Policies spelled out, Very Corporate, lots of chances for training, company in good financial shape
cons: Upper Management not in touch with employees, Too spread out, expected to work too many hours, employees requests not listened to

job_title: Part Time Teller in Emporia, VA
pros: good company with great benefits! and off for your birthday. There a lot of branches on the east coast, so you will be able to transfer to different areas. Also have a lot of different career oppurtunities
cons: Company has had a lot of cut backs lately. Employees that have been there 20+ years have been cut back to part time hours.

job_title: Branch Banker IV in Knoxville, TN
pros: 401K match is 6 percent. Unbelievable amount of sick time. The people I work with are wonderful.
cons: No communication from regional management. Market leaders overworked and many not qualified. Staffing is a nightmare. Better hit your numbers or you could be the next one fired.

pros: Sought full family orientated company, goal driven minimal sales pressure. Results of sales tracked and pay is $1 for $1.
cons: Requirement to step out into the community and retrieve business on a warm lead. Sales plan can seem unrealistic in some aspects.

pros: It was a lot of fun at times.  I worked with good people and I enjoyed my clients.
cons: There was little room to grow.  With recent restructuring it was hard to see working there as a career

pros: Well balanced, challenging environment, room for advancement in a great environment
cons: Salaries are not competive with changing times of other financial institutions. If you went to College, your salary will not change than if someone didn't go to college

job_title: Customer Service Representative I in Wilson, NC
pros: I like the staff and the management. Training is organized. An early career start for a recent graduate who is still trying to figure out what they want to do.
cons: Overall the pay is not worth the rude customers. You are told you can grow within the company but it seems like they want to keep you in the customer service career path

job_title: Process Improvement Consultant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Pension, 6% 401k match, OK vacation (after tenure of 5 years)
cons: Its a bank... so - process change risk averse, slow to change, hierarchical, can be penny wise and dollar foolish.

review_title: Stay Away-unless you want to work 6-7 days a week
pros: Generous vacation time. 401K match
cons: Poorly staffed offices,  no concern for work life balance,  bad management, no compassion for over worked under paid employees. Can’t even furnish basic office supplies. Poorly operated branches with staff schedules that make no sense. Rated on customer feedback and mystery shops that you have little control over because clients have to wait because branches are so severely understaffed.

review_title: BB&T is a great company to work for.
pros: BB&T values family and I love their incentive program.
cons: I wasn't to big on pushing a sale on a customer especially if I knew that they did not need the service.

job_title: Certified Senior Teller in Kissimmee, FL
pros: Medical and dental insurance  401k pension plan. Stock options
cons: The do not promote African Americans from within very easily ..instead choose to bring in under qualified Hispanics.  And Readily promote and provide accelerated training to them. I have been there for a number of years and have been dicouraged and passed over for positions that I am qualified for.  The company is GROWING BUT cutting the benwfits and hours of LONGTIME employees

pros: Good benefits, stable company, pension, good branding
cons: Corporate America, difficult to close mortgage loans on time for your customers due to poor processing system, difficult to build realtor loyalty when loan process is filled with problems

pros: Everyone is so friendly and helpful in the transition to a new position. Leadership really is top notch and it trickles down to all levels of management.
cons: Roles and responsibilities are constantly changing. It is frustrating when you finally get into the groove a position.

pros:
Excellent benefits package
Match 401 (k) contribution up to 6%
Somewhat of a possibility for advancement
cons: Unfortunately,  BB&T upper management no longer cares about the individual holding the position, just the position itself. They used to be more client driven but are now more sales driven.

pros: The best thing about working this position is the level of interaction with clients. Some of them rely on you daily.
cons: There is a lot of pressure to reach your sales goals, and at times they are difficult to reach because of the area your branch is in.

job_title: Customer Service Representative I in Greensboro, NC
pros: The benefits are best here as far health care, vision and dental go. The on-site cafeteria is has Ann abundance of options. Also the company culture is amazing here.
cons: The only negative I have is that the elevators are always breaking down constantly. Other than that this is the best job I have every had and I'm not blowing smoke.

pros: If you are looking for a position where you can sit down all day on the phone this is for you.
cons: I personally did not enjoy my time at BB&T, this bank is targeted for people with money then yet, most branches are located in low income communities where it is highly difficult to find people with good credit and high profitable businesses.

review_title: If banking is the industry you like then BB&T is a good company.
pros: A lot of potential growth in Texas. If you like banking then a great company with good benefits. Has training and employee recognition on a regular basis.
cons: I come from restaurant and was told my experience would translate well to banking. That was not entirely true but the environment is the opposite of restaurant.

review_title: Do your research, discern the red flags and make a calculated move.
pros: good benefits and competitive pay.
cons:
Cultural and relationship dynamics reflect subliminal racial discrimination displayed in team interactions, inclusiveness and group belongingness.

Employee expectations are not honestly communicated during interview process--such as overtime work and other circumstantial work-load.

Complaints are not handled confidentially and can threaten job security.

job_title: Merchant Services Consultant in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Excellent recognition with clients. Almost never had issues with client being upset with bank. Most all are the best people I've dealt with in the last 10 years in the industry because they mirror the Market Leader's personality which is always awesome or they wouldn't be a BB&T employee.
cons: Have a lot of work after hours keeping Salesforce, etc updated.

review_title: A middle of the road place to work
pros: Business Ethics are sound. They have not gotten in hot water like other banks who made questionable, risky loans.
cons: Some the managers are great and some are micromanagers. Alot of IT jobs are being outsourced to India.

pros:
I am still trying to find,,,,finding.............did not find anything.. ............! 
Quit trying to find a pro !!
cons:
Mental stress
Incompetent management & leadership
To get things done you are at the mercy of everyone.
Impolite attitude
Give up nights and weekends
Practically it is not possible to do work even if you try to !
Will be promoted if you are ready to wipe $$$ !
Don't expect a pay hike for years
Bonus is a joke
High attrition -----TRUST ME THIS IS IN EVERY DEPT

endless...you will find one which I haven't for sure

job_title: Teller Part Time in Boone, NC
pros:
The team of people whom I worked with were wonderful!
Get lots of long weekends due to bank holidays.
You learn a lot about banking
cons: lunch hours are never consistent

pros: The benefits are pretty good!  There even better if you are signed up for the Peak Health program.  The vacation package would be better if you could buy days again.
cons: Management is non existent!  People (employees) walk all over you. There is no room for advancement.

job_title: Branch Banker III in Houston, TX
pros: You learn a lot about different roles in the branch.  Staffing is limited so you will need to learn everything from teller/banker/manager in order to run the branch.  You get your birthday off.
cons: Sales quotas, no room to grow in company, health benefits are ridiculous: expensive and high deductibles.  Training is done virtual.

pros: For right now, benefits are good
cons: Pay is low for what they expect and regional management is truly out of touch with the reality of what goes on in the locations.

job_title: Team Leader I in Phila, PA
pros: BB&T has the best interest of their clients first. They want their clients to achieve economic success and financial security and they give us the tools and training to help them do that.
cons: I can't say anything negative. I've been with the company over a year and still love my job.

pros: Health insurance and retirement plan.
cons: In this company is not possible to advance. BBT  rather to gives opportunity of outside people that their own employees that have been working in here for years and want to move positions. The company not gives you a life balance. The company takes your ideas and not recognize you for it. Really bad salary. If you want to work here, you may need to have another person to help in the household because you can not live with this salary.

review_title: BB&T is a Great company to work for
pros: Bankers hours are always nice! Competitive pay and good benefits. JDPower listed as top employer as well as top bank
cons: Dealing with public can be challenging. Sales are required of all branch employees. Some Saturdays are required depending on location.

review_title: It is a good company and environment.
pros: Fair comp. Room to advance. Continuing education is available at the company if an employee seeks it. The company’s reputation is well respected.
cons: Some poor leadership exists in some areas Leaders apply expectations to their subordinates that they do not fully embrace themselves. This can create a negative vibe in the office

review_title: Dallas management is terribly misaligned from overall leadership.
job_title: Branch Manager/Financial Center Leader in Dallas, TX
pros: Great advancement potential for banker level because managers burn out so quickly.  There is great training & encouragement for sales success.
cons: Extreme B of A style sales pressure without the infrastructure. When regional leadership is coming, everyone gets tense and afraid they will be written up.

pros: BB&T believes in its people.  There is a lot of opportunity for employees to advance and move around.  It is a respectful work environment with lots of thanks and kudos for doing your job.
cons: It is no frills.  This is a conservative bank with a lot of emphasis on cost optimization so there is no free coffee, no free water etc.  Employees must bone up for this.

pros: Off on weekends in Greater Birmingham Area
cons: The company thrives on saving money, but they work their employees like crazy by not hiring more help. There is not much opportunity for growth, and the company is very unorganized. Upper management doesn't take the chance to come out and visit their branches to see how the employees really struggle, and they make horrible decisions that affect the branches and the employees.  I would never recommend them to anyone unless they didn't have anywhere else to go.

job_title: Compensation Consultant, Assistant Vice President in High Point, NC
pros: Great Executive Management team. Fantastic mission and values. Benefits are great with a matching 6% 401k. Support efforts in the community in which they serve.
cons: Some departments struggle with work/life balance. No opportunity for outside certifications paid for by the company. Some departments do not have a mutually supportive environment.

job_title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant II in Birmingham, AL
pros: It was a miniature family setting because it was the Op Center. For the most part, everyone got along well together. Most supervisors were helpful in helping you to succeed and with that comes trust. Overall, I enjoyed my many years there.
cons: Raises were behind what they should have been.

job_title: Business Service Officer in Houston, TX
pros: Great benefits, management is very solid, stable company. A lot of opportunities as the company continues to grow throughout the US.
cons: Very old school in the way the bank processes loans. Nothing sexy about the job. In a new market you have no book of business so you have to grow your portfolio from scratch.

pros: Bonuses can be good.  Friendly culture below the management level.
cons: BB&T wants to be a big bank, but is still operating like a small company.  Lack of processes and standards have resulted in a lot of internal issues.  Executive Management is out of touch.

job_title: Part Time Teller in College Station, TX
pros: Flexible hours, benefits, good pay, friendly people, lots of learning opportunities, competitive pay, knowledge of banking practices, presentation opportunities, company keeps employees well trained
cons: Working in customer service, hard to move up, lack of new positions for someone who has spent a lot of time with the company

job_title: Bank Teller in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Great training & process. I would have stayed with BB&T except we moved out of area where they are located.
cons: Too corporate, prefer community banking approach. Some employees who were trying to get ahead were pretty cut throat, but I viewed that as an individual issue and not BB&T’s doing.

job_title: Branch Banker I in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great pension and 401k match with phenomenal employees to work for and with.  Lighthouse project is a great way to give back!
cons: Technology is a little behind the times.... they are slowly improving it though!

pros: BB&T is overall a great company to work for, the benefits outweigh its Shortcomings. My supervisor is pretty good about scheduling and is great with working around appointments.
cons: Getting paid once a month is challenging at times. The criticalness of your role can make you feel like your always coming up short.

job_title: FInancial Center Leader III in Richmond, VA
pros: The Company inself is solid, with the bottom line always a focus.
cons: The Central Virginia Leadership is comprised of the same type of person, gender, and age. There is no diversity and no decision making ability by the Area Managers.

review_title: BB&T was a product driven, competitive work environment where it was difficult to  nurture the client relationship.
job_title: Relationship Banker II in Tampa, FL
pros: The company was financially sound.
cons: The financial center managers were not held accountable for their branch's shortcomings.

pros: Benefits are really good! 9-5 work week is nice. Flexible spending accounts
cons: Un realistic sales goals. Management only cares about sales sales sales!! banking stuck in the 1920s. If you have had a banking postion before this company is nothing like that position. Expect to function as a banker tet be paid and treated as a teller.

pros: Decent Pay in comparison to similar positions at other institutions. Unlimited current overtime. Given laptops so that you can work from home on the weekends.
cons: Impossible pipelines with processor typically the only person who contacts clients.  Files sit in underwriting and closing for weeks and processors are stuck with the turn time that is out of their control.

pros: Good company with great values
cons: Pay is not competitive and it is difficult to move up unless you have gone through the company leadership program. Pay increases are inconsistent and not applied fairly.

job_title: Loss Mitigation Specialist in Greenville, SC
pros: Friendly people in management. Nice down to earth coworkers. Great benefits. Work hours are flexible to a certain extent.
cons: Training is not thorough enough for new employees. Advancement is not based on tenure any longer. Little employee appreciation

pros: Good benefits great pay easy hiring process. Very detailed position, but well worth effort. Do your job and you will be fine
cons: Recruiting really should stay on task. Stay in touch or you will be left out of hiring process. Can be stressful at times

pros: Banking hours (M-F 8-4, off all weekends and holidays)
cons: Salary, very limiting policies and procedures. EVERYTHING must go through approval steps outside the branch

pros: This is a solid financial bank to work for if you want a career in banking.  The executive management team is very down to earth and is concerned about the culture of the company.
cons: There is more need for advanced technology and there should be more women and diversity in the executive level of the company.

pros: Good Benefits at a good cost
cons: Work load too heavy.....employees were expected to keep up with normal workload as well as employee shortages and new growth.

job_title: FInancial Center Leader III in Washington, DC
pros:
No micromanagement---only micro manage employees that need it
Good benefits
Fast advancement
Great salary
cons:
LDP loyalty is high, meaning, they may get opportunities they don't deserve
moving towards to widget goals vs revenue based

review_title: Good company to work for bad managers
pros: A few reasons are good benefits and stability.
cons: No advancement opportunities.  Managers have no interest in improving overall efficiency because they fear loosing their jobs! They have been there for 20+ years and are very resistant to innovation.

pros:
Opportunities are available .... if you know the right people and you look for them
Benefits
cons:
Slow in changing and moving forward with IT technologies
Good Old boy network  -  Hard for females to move up into IT Mgmt

pros: Family atmosphere, great work culture and absolutely wonderful bosses
cons: If you have to deal with visa hassles, immigration department does tend get lethargic, does not reply back sometimes to your questions. Training outside of the company is hard to come by. Also work from home options when you aboslutely need them are very limited

pros: Stable company, great coworkers, great benefits. Lots of career growth. Invests in employees.
cons: technology is dated. this is a cost saving measure, but it hinders customer service

pros: If you are motivated there is no shortfall of work present. Management strongly promotes those who can sell.
cons: Company became too focused on sales abd lost sight of the clients and the employees.

pros: Wonderful benefits ( healthcare, vacation, FMLA) along with bank holidays of course. Normal boring conference calls and sales calls are actually motivational.
cons: The rate of progression can sometimes take longer then other financial institutions leaving associates feeling as if they've been overlooked. The process for annual reviews/compensation increase are out dated.

pros: Great values and mission, truly a company that cares about its employees and clients.
cons: Sometimes the core values and mission doesn't flow down to the retail employees or the lower level managers.

pros: The people I worked with were always great. I enjoyed the clients we had and the laid back atmosphere we created.
cons: Not enough help in the branches. Upper management has no idea what is going on in the branches and how poorly staffed they are. They expect you to do the work of 5 people but refuse to pay for that.

pros: Job Stability, Pension plan is good if you are a lifer, Casual Fridays, decent benefits if you are single.
cons: Not ideal for younger people, culture is slow to change and risk adverse.

job_title: Branch Banker III in Dover, PA
pros: They offer 40 sick days a year, which can be used for doctors appointments, children's school activities, etc. Benefits are decent. People are very helpful.
cons: Communication lacks. Only 2 weeks vacation to start, even if you're from a newly merged bank. You have to work 5 years to get another week of vacation.

pros: Great benefits and generous PTO. All FTEs get 40 sick days plus vacation. Vacation time is dependent on officer status. 2 weeks vacation for non-officer and 3+ for officers of the bank
cons: Slow to promote and salaries are not market competitive

job_title: Loan Loss Mitigation Specialist I in Mauldin, SC
pros: My team is great! The manger and Unit Lead are extremely helpful. The benefits are GREAT! I have a flexible work schedule which makes managing my personal and professional life easy. It's a great working environment.
cons: There aren't any incentives. There isn't an opportunity to advance.

pros: Hours were normal and benefits were okay.
cons: Everything else. Sometimes I just look back in awe of how backwards this place was. They prey on workers with their backs up against the wall. Single mothers or anybody who can't afford to quit. It was absolutely ridiculous how disorganized everything was from top to bottom. The work environments were toxic with sales culture and general drama.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Wilson, NC
pros: Strong company with successful future. Love their core mission and vision. BB&T truly does live by their mission and vision.
cons: Pay is not competitive and you feel torn between working for a good company while trying to keep your lights on and family fed.

pros: They care about their associates.  Not just on a professional development level but on a personal level too.
cons: They are going through a learning curve for how much they have grown in size over the past few years.  There have been and there will be some more bumps in the road as they adjust.

review_title: They need to transition to the current century.
pros: The hours were good at first, but eventually they want you to work more for no increase in pay.
cons: Very tight with their pocketbook.  Literally told to turn off the lights when we left at night and to keep the paperclips.  Though upper level is paid very well.

job_title: Annuity Wholesaler in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Easy hiring process. Flexibility in work schedule.
cons: Management is not unified in company goals and desired focuses. My job responsibilities were very unclear, had multiple bosses and none were on the same page as to what my responsibilities were.

job_title: Peak Time Teller in Plano, TX
pros:
Little work, clients are mostly the elderly, or from out of state.

Walk in traffic not as much as Chase, so you definitely have a lot of down time.

Great employees, great bank to work at that actually appreciates their employees and want to help clients
cons: Sales goals. But you will get that at every single bank.

pros: Learn many aspects of retail banking and personal finance. You will learn how to advise clients to achieve financial success.
cons: Restructuring of the company has lead to an exodus of employees. Managers have become micromanagers and constantly threating about  future employment. The tides are rough.

pros: Time off for Holidays were great
cons: Not enough employees to cover calls, Customers very dissatisfied with the hold time at times over 100 calls holding. everyday and sometimes on busy days 200 holding. they have freeze on hiring but keep taking on new loans. 27 employees left in less than 9 months over worked

pros: Great atmosphere and people to work with.  Fantastic 401k and pension!  Ablility to balance work and personal life.  Not micro-managed by supervisor.
cons: Behind in technology, but getting better!  Sometimes can get overwhelmed with "lists" for contacting bank clients.  Performance goals for bank personnel can be stressful.

pros: You get excellent benefits starting out and the pay is competitive.
cons: The system is very slow and there are a lot of nitpicky rules that seem like they're always changing.  They will also work you full  time hours as a part timer but will turn back around and cut your hours in half at a moments notice.

job_title: Branch Relationship Banker in Dallas, TX
pros: Great team to work, even visits with the VP's from NC were awesome. Super friendly employees, job pace was decent and quality of career life was wonderful! I'd work for them again!
cons: Took away sales incentives, sales goals were kind of extreme at times, sales calls were brutal.

review_title: opportunity, but not necessarily for everyone
job_title: Relationship Banker II in Marietta, GA
pros: Pay is good and benefits are also good. Good job security.
cons: lack of potential to move up fairly, will tell you almost anything to get you to stay, do not follow through on their word

pros: great place to work management really cares
cons: there arent really any cons here @ BB&T management is very good and actually cares about their employees for the most part

pros: Very good benefit package, thorough training, lots of incentives, great enviornment. Very comfortable workplace, value oriented company make sure employees convey the values the company is based on.
cons: Supervisors and Team Leads show favortism, this is not reflective of the company but rather the people that the company promote to these positions.

pros:
Maintains a human touch while running a successful bank
Works to have employees maintain a genuine relation with clients
cons:
Management is very conservative with a bent toward making political statements to employees
Management thinks that it has a great relationship with employees which isn't always true.

review_title: Best Bank in Town? - it could be
pros:
Values-based culture
Good people, collegial atmosphere
Client-centric
cons:
Expense control has become the official sport; Focus is on the very short term
All hiring decisions (including replacements of existing personnel must be approved by Executive Management
Technology spend (website, CRM) is inadequate for a firm this size

pros: Good benefits, pension, 401 (K), overall mission and vision minded to be the best of the best in banking.
cons: Work-life balance is very difficult if you are a clustered manager.  Upper management is spread very thin and could not possibly understand the difficulties of branch management with their large number of direct reports and responsibilities.

job_title: Market Leader III, Assistant Vice President in Wilmington, NC
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: Managers expect more than anyone can produce.  Work life balance is none.  Branches are discussing, dirty and in disrepair.  It's all about the sale.  Worse than Wells Fargo or Bank of America.  Salary is far lower than industry standard.

pros: Worked with great people and had a very good system. The training period was very informative.
cons: There was a lot of team building that was unnecessary.

review_title: Excellent management training program, knowledgeable teammates, generally good working environment
pros: BB&T sets management trainees up with a great base of knowledge both in and out of the classroom and this leads to success. BB&T hires some of the best people in the business. The overall work environment is teamwork oriented and friendly.
cons: BB&T doesn't always listen to employees concerns.

job_title: Commercial Sales Assistant in Greensboro, NC
pros: BB&T promotes from within. BB&T has great values. Training is great. Matching 40-1k up to 6% Pension after 5 years of service. Has a Wellness program that provides discounts on insurance. BB&T also contributes to the HSA plan.
cons: Great company no cons for me

job_title: Branch Banker II in College Station, TX
pros: Good work/ life ratio. Decent benefits
cons: Dependent on your manager no room for growth within company. Which is strange cause that's one of the core values of the company

pros: Bb&T has great benefits such as insurance and a pension,the company is values driven and client focused.
cons: No room for advancement and low annual raises. Oh and extremely outdated systems and internal policies. Sometimes feel like the focus is not on keeping associates happy, but rather on the top tier making money.

job_title: Branch Relationship Banker in Doral, FL
pros: Friendly staff with good hours and very clean offices. Very easy to communicate with upper staff and colleagues. The office hours are fair.
cons: Not the most up to date systems. The systems for scanning your work to the back office is out of date as well as the drive thru systems in some locations

review_title: Best Fin Svcs company in the Triangle
job_title: Manager In Information Technology in Raleigh, NC
pros: GREAT leadership - competent, fair, structured.  Johnson is one of the better CIO's in banking.  Strong Senior Team. Lots of respect and mutual trust.  Plenty of money and re-investment in the IT shop.
cons: Sporadic travel between Wilson, Raleigh, Winston, Charlotte... not bad at at all,

review_title: very disappointing, poor upper and middle management,
pros: Perks of working for a bank (loans, accounts, etc). Location was good. Fellow employees / peers we're competent and pleasurable to work with.
cons: Very poor upper and mid management. Little respect for employees, little advancement and most of all little appreciation for internet business strategies vs. brick and mortar.

review_title: Keep this as a last option
pros: Benefits. 401k, pension & sick leaves.
cons:
Programmers are not treated well.
No cooperation between departments. Each unit operates as if they were a different company.
Too many stupid and redundant policies resulting in slow progress.

job_title: Teller Supervisor in Lake Worth, FL
pros: I love BB&T because of their values, their Mission and their Vision. It's not only written in a book, but all employees can feel it in their daily routine.
cons: I m not sure I can find something negative to say about BBT.

pros: The people are really genuine. The benefits are fantastic! The company truly has a strong culture that they operate by. Hard work is often recognized.
cons: Communication through the company can be lacking and disorganized. They tend to treat the people who work in corporate headquarters better than anyone else in the footprint.

review_title: The company has been good to me in the time I worked there.
pros: BB&T is a good company to work for, there is opportunity to grow and make a career.
cons: The part that is not working for me is the schedule. It changes every week and I don't feel I have the freedom to work with my time.

pros: If you are in their community banking division their is little sales pressure compared to competitors.  They offer excellent health insurance
cons: If you are looking to grow your career and develop new skills BB&T is not the place for you.  Compensation packages are on very low end compared with competitors.

review_title: Only cares about the bottom line
pros: Starting pay is good, above average.
cons: No room for advancement, no such thing as a flexible schedule. Was once scheduled to work a 3 hour shift,  just so the manager would not have to close. Cold Calling is worst part of the job.

pros: Great atmosphere with upper management that actually cares and listens to your input. Great job security and great benefits as well.
cons: Pay for workload was a little slack. Volume of work was immense and goals were raised every time they were met, making them near impossible to meet towards the end, which meant no quarterly bonus.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in New York, NY
pros: The pay was better than at some centers I've worked and the hours are nice except during the winter time.
cons: The benefits are really really expensive and management is kinda stagnant and it seems cliquey . Some of the people are ok but many would throw you under the bus.

pros: Good pay, good benefits and nice hours.
cons: I disliked my time working for BB&T very much. All my coworkers wanted to talk about were Donald Trump and politics. The banks are very understaffed, and very busy- meaning many angry patrons. All around, I hated going into work everyday.

review_title: Large bank environment, just a number
pros: Great people to work with,  enjoyed the job, learned a lot.
cons: Large bank, always looking where cuts can be made, in the end just a number to them.

review_title: Don't plan on opportunity. There is a constant fear of losing jobs due to mergers. Bank has $ to buy other banks...
pros: Good benefits. Growth for retail
cons: If you are in a specific line of business, plan on doing the same thing forever

review_title: Make more at any other bank
job_title: Branch Banker III in Nashville, TN
pros: Short hours, no weekends, easy work.
cons: Lack of support from upper management. Always understaffed. No brand recognition in the area. Coworkers were catty and would get you in trouble to either cover themselves or out of sheer boredom. Pay was low and incentives were laughable compared to industry standard.

job_title: Mortgage Loan Processor II in Greer, SC
pros: Flexible work hours, fun atmosphere, open door policy, managers do step in when it's needed, & the structure of each roles responsibilities are clearly defined
cons: Having to be in your current position for 18 months before your allowed to change positions. Growth potential is there but you have to be very patient

pros: Health insurance and 401k, Paid holiday.
cons: lack of interest of higher managers to a lower positions needs and words. If someone higher than you does not like you for any personal reason it is their words against you even if you come up with all the evidence that they were wrong and you did your job perfectly fine.

review_title: High sales goals but great culture
pros: Culture of learning and improvement. Very down-to-earth senior management that appear to be approachable and consistent in their leadership. Lateral and horizontal movements are readily available if you are willing and patient (6 months to a year for a position to open up I'd say)
cons: Sales pressure, old school, slow innovation.

job_title: Branch Banker I in Landis Valley, PA
pros:
amazing benefits and great pay - even for part time compared to most banks in the area
work/life balance is very fair
excellent teamwork between back/front office
plenty of opportunity to advance for those who want to
relocation is generally an option
sales goals are based on branch totals not individuals (tellers)
cons: not on the west coast :(

pros: Some good people with great technical skills. Ability to work from home. Solid company in the financial market. Diverse technologies.
cons: Expensive health care for family.  1.5 years before I would be eligible for bonus. No coffee or snacks. Dismissal office environment.

pros:
Pay.
Paid Vacation
Paid Federal Holidays
No work on Sundays 
Only 4 hours on Saturdays
cons:
Sales-they want you to “inform” clients of different products we have but what they really want is for us to “sell” the client the product.
Schedules are not done fairly.

pros: My department and immediate supervision are very laid back and do not micro-manage. Flexible work schedule, family/personal well being are prioritized over work. Wellness program greatly reduces medical coverage costs and stay long enough and you'll earn a good amount of vacation.
cons: Low pay, slow to advance, work environment is stale, small budgets.

pros: Decent base pay and benefits compared to some of the larger banks.
cons: Low commissions compared to the larger banks. You will also be required to seek out new small business accounts, all while spending half of your time behind the teller line balancing your drawer each time before returning to your desk.

pros: Monday morning meetings were great!
cons: Show lots of favoritism, upper management is very unprofessional,  branches are always short staffed but yet they still expect the "perfect client experience." They promote who they like not necessarily who is qualified.  They have a lot of people that have been there for years that need to be let go mainly in upper management.

pros: Well-run bank at the senior level.  Relatively conservative balance sheet.  A survivor in a very tough market environment for regional banks.
cons: Focus on cost containment often at expense of revenue growth.  Management at subsidiaries overly short-term focused.  Old boy network in full effect

pros: Overall this is a great company. I would by the stock.
cons: However, if you are a teller it will take you 4 years minimum to move up just to teller manager. Managers are rude, and lacked any managerial skills or intelligence. They also push to sell sell sell!

pros: High focus on client satisfaction, and adherance to responsible business practices as outlined in Vision, Mission and Values of the company.
cons: As the banks is growing, more aspects which were handled locally are being centralized, such as lending authority. This however is unavoidable once any bank grows past a certain size.

job_title: Branch Banker in San Antonio, TX
pros: Very good training, good culture, values-driven company. People are extremely friendly and very supportive of each other.
cons: Very conservative ways to do business, traditional values. I work in Texas and its hard to line up the traditional ways to Texas way of doing business.

pros: Exceptional benefits, one of the strongest financial institutions in the country, outstanding culture, many opportunities for advancement and flexibility with time off.  The best bank I had ever worked for.
cons: Way behind the times in IT and systems integration.

pros: I been working in the finance industry for 10 years and have worked at some of the largest banks in the country. BB&T is a great place to work; great company values.
cons: No cons to share at this time.

job_title: Branch Banker II in Baltimore, MD
pros: The insurance benefits and the pay is good. Many people have the ability to grow within the company.
cons: Managers at the branch level only care about sales. Some managers will treat clients w. A lot of many better than an ordinary client

pros: Relatively stable company, decent benefits.  Close knit teams that have a wealth of knowledge.
cons: A lot of times it's about who you know versus what you know.  Behind the 8 ball in terms of technology.

job_title: Security Specialist III in Winston-Salem, NC

Great Benefits and flexible hours.
Team environment.  Company seems to care about it's employees as well as the community.   Terrific place to work.
cons: Employees are paid once a month.  Pay scales and pay cycles need to be updated.  Forces employees to manage money so that part is not a complete negative.

pros:
Work one sat a month. 
Doesn’t stay open late on Saturday or mon-thu
Part time gets paid 14% for healthcare so a little extra money 
They pay gas mileage if you work at a different branch
cons:
No benefits 
On call; 
Hard to move to a full time teller
Machines are old! Bank is behind with technology

review_title: They are only concerned with the accounts that have money.  They don't care much about the little people.
pros: The co-workers who stayed after our bank was bought out.
cons: Only seem to care about the accounts that have money.  Fees are outrageous and they are not willing to work with clients.  Sales goals are ridiculous.

pros: BB&T has friendly employees and customers, and good  systems and controls in place.  There are career opportunities if you desire to advance in the banking industry.
cons: It is repetitive work and I did not like the need to sell/pitch other account products and loans

review_title: Not honoring my Pension benefits after 6 years with BB&T and 16 years with McGriff, Seibels & Willaims
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst III in Birmingham, AL
pros: Don't see any Pros unless you want to work under constant stress and impossible deadlines.
cons: They work you too hard without letting up and put you under constant stress. Pension  is not given to all employees who do the same work.

pros: No one bothers you, but you must do everything. START to FINISH. Hope you have time and the patience to learn not only your roll, but many!
cons: Lacking in technology, putting production to a standstill, horrible staffing and management is not helpful in solving problems.

pros: Strong Company, Fair and Equitable. Willing to work with my college schedule.

They drag their feet making hiring or promotion decisions.
They also don't seem very excited to move employees up unless you push.

review_title: Good base salary, poor incentive program
pros:
Good base salary and work/life balance
Great Training
cons:
Poor Incentive Program
Lack of Leadership at the Top
Promotions only given to LDP graduates

pros:
The way they came in and took over during the Colonial Bank disaster was awesome.
The employees that were living in that nightmare were thrilled the day BB&T took control and breathed a huge sigh of relief.
cons: My position was eliminated when the merger was complete, however the severance package was very generous.

review_title: Good, strong, ethical bank with an almost family-like work environment. Many employees socialize afterhours & weekends.

cons: Low base salary and "capped" bonuses. Large breakdown in communication between upper and middle management.

pros: Good Values and culture at company level.
cons: Very much a political contest on who gets promoted. Very poor training or sometimes none. I have had to cover the platform side since starting and was never cross trained.

pros: Good values, strong emphasis on leadership. Strong on professional development and identifying talent. Strong bank and very corporately structured but still maintained small, personal feel in each branch. Very awesome benefits package, really made an effort to treat employees well.
cons: Lots of red tape at times, but that is the banking industry

review_title: Great experience,  they make sure they train you well and give you all the tools you may need.
pros: Great start pay compared to similar jobs in the area.
cons: Sales, they want you to continuously sell products to everyone that walks in the branch. Limited time to sell products to clients.

pros: Excellent benefit package.  Very good support system and internal processes.  Very strong brand
cons: Not always competitive compensation,  very high goals and high pressure. Not always competitive on pricing and risk grading

pros: Huge bank. Lots of branches in South Florida
cons: Little advancement opportunities in Florida unless you work in a branch.

pros: the only pro is that it is close to home
cons: still a lot of old school thinking managers in terms of remote work. Socialized healthcare cost. If you make over $90k you will be charged more for the same healthcare with horrible coverage by the way.

review_title: Limited opportunity for advancement and low compensation, but nice company to work for.
pros: Big company with a small company feel.
cons: Technology is lagging behind industry standard, both hardware and software need to be updated.

review_title: Great People, not satisfied with job
pros: BB&T employs a plethora of great people that are value based and friendly
cons: BB&T has lower than normal salary compensation for its employees while at the same time having a less than robust benefits package unless you are a tenured employee

review_title: BB&T is a good company to start out.
pros: A company with Great values and benefits.
cons: While there is a clear path for Branch management; if you want to choose a career path of Operations and auditing you will need to know people in the upper management.

pros: Great work/life balance, paid time off/holidays, good health care, relatively good working environment
cons: culture of low work ethic, must put in a lot of time in company to move up, culture of tardiness and lateness

review_title: Benefits are great, chance for advancement-slim, company is downsizing
pros: Benefits are great!  Hope they continue for current and future employees.
cons: Business is so busy, growth may not be given in case the employee diligently seeks.  It is a job and one must not take it for grant it.

pros: Benefits package, usually close knit group you work with, continually BB&T but taking over other banks. Never bought out. Strong industry
cons: New age of management is just not what is used to be. NO "real" ways to work up to better positions. No true coaching of employees.

review_title: Worked with great people, the bureaucracy was sometimes hard to deal with.
pros: Great benefits. The people I worked with were great. Pay was comprable to similar jobs. Even sales referral bonus opportunities exist.
cons: Bureaucratic nightmare. As with many corporations, even the most insignificant decisions had to be forwarded to the main office for approval.

job_title: Risk and Control Analyst III in Hunt Valley, MD
pros: Acquired Susquehanna Bancshares and was helpful in finding a new job and keeping us informed, when necessary.  Nice place to work.
cons: Could not always answer our questions during acquisition.  They have been through many acquisitions and should have been able to answer the questions, based on previous acquisitions.

review_title: Not a bad job, but an old fashioned company
pros: good benefits, steady work (they give you the hours they say they will)
cons: Old fashioned, (women are mostly in support roles), like any bank job it is very conservative, just expect it to be similar to working in a bank in the 50's

pros: Vacation, insurance with Peak Health, holiday, bonus for meeting yearly sales goals, coworkers were great, some managers treat their employees great
cons: Technology outdated, understaffed, black out dates affect vacations, more responsibility but no increase in pay, change in titles, no more teller supervisor positions

review_title: A lot of good coworkers and some good projects

pros: Nice people, a good design process with opportunities to learn, and some higher profile public-facing projects.
cons: Politics in some departments and outdated tools/software (common in finance though). There can be long stretches between projects where things get slow.

review_title: If you drink the Kool-Aid, you'll succeed at BB&T.
pros: Good Benefits, PTO, and Training.
cons: Only 20+ year male veterans from large banks or BB&T University Graduates are promoted at BB&T.

pros: They value their employees and never take advantage of them. I've been blessed with the co-workers and management I work with. Their is never a dull day at work; it is always productive. THey also offer great benefits.
cons: None, It is a great place to work at

review_title: I love the people I work with and our clients are the best.

review_title: BBT its all bad...I think your experience depends on which branch you get assigned to.

pros: Great place to work if you don't care about benefits and want to work less than 20 hours a week.

pros: The training at BB&T is great
cons: can not advance due to upper management

pros: You learn a lot about insurance and different processes.  Very structured but due to the constant changes in the insurance industry some processes may be outdated.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Greensboro, NC

job_title: Relationship Banker II in Lake Mary, FL
pros: Great training, great management, great benefits. This is a great bank overall. Loved my experience and the culture at this bank.

pros: Great Atmosphere BB&T was a great company to work for. I only left because of a new opportunity but I may be going back.

review_title: Great place to begin a career

review_title: As long as you have great management you will be fine.

review_title: Great benefit, lower salary compared to peer institutions.

pros: they give insurance and every benefit to even part time employees. they have continuous professional development program which keeps you updated.

pros: Great work/life balance with competitive pay.  They work with you to keep you happy and productive. Stable job environment

job_title: On Call Teller in Birmingham, AL

review_title: Pros and cons of a career at BB&T.
